Deep Reinforcement Learning for Rough Terrain

Autonomous Systems and Biomechatronics Lab

MASc Student - Sep. 2018 - Present

This project developed a novel sim-to-real pipeline that allows a mobile robot to effectively learn how to safety navigate real-world 3D rough terrain environments using a unique combination of strategies to directly address the reality gap for such environments. The pipeline uses Asynchronous Advantage Actor Critic (A3C) to learn a navigation policy from training data obtained from the simulated environment.

Experiments in the real-world 3D cluttered environment verified that the robot was able to successfully navigate from numerous arbitrary starting locations to numerous arbitrary goal locations while effectively traversing the rough terrain.

I augmented a remote controlled 4x4 wheel platform into an autonomous rough terrain vehicle with. Giving it simultaneous localization and mapping capabilites (SLAM) using ROS, LiDAR, active stereo camera and depth camera. The platform uses two onboard computers that communicates with using a distributed ROS-Master network connected over LAN. One of the computers is an Intel NUC for running RTAB-MAP as the SLAM algorithm. The other computer is a Nvidia Jetson Tx2 for driving GPU heavy applications such as depth image localization. To improve with the wheel slippage issues in rough terrain, PID controllers were implemented to controll both the global motion of the platform and the individual wheel velocity.

Paper in progress.

Project Link

ROS C++ Python Pytorch SolidWorks SLAM Control Reinforcement Learning

Parallel Proximal Policy Optimization

Parallel Proximal Policy Optimization

Personal Project Nov. 2019

This project was a parallel version of PPO reinforcement learning algorithm, modified from an existing implementation. The purpose of this was to decrease training time by using parallel processes to simultaneously collect training samples. The collective experiences of all agents were pooled into a reply buffer that is sampled from when updating the network.
